Articles.Content:
Hello everyone! This is UpsilonAerospace/Bagel Rabbit.

Here's my initial foray into Kerbal Space Program 0.24! In this series, I'm going to try to recover every single part of every single spacecraft I've flown. It will be difficult... but I think that it can be done, for Science! (And contracts.)

First Launch: 1 SRB, 1 Parachute, Three Modular Girder "Landing Legs." Sweet and simple, and when the SRB is thrust-limited, it gets you High-Altitude Science data.

Second Launch: A big stack of fuel tanks, three LVT-45 Engines, Mystery Goo, parachutes and Modular Girder "Landing Legs." Capable of reaching suborbital space, though not orbit. Also, a bit more wobbly than I would like. WILL UNLOCK STRUTS SOON!

I hope you enjoyed this video! Please leave comments or suggestions, and I'll be posting the next episode tomorrow!

Have a very nice day, Individuals! Like, Favorite, Subscribe and Share please, and I'll see you next time with another episode of the KeeeEEEEEErbal Space Program!

PEACE!

Alright!

Here's Episode 2 of KSP 0.24! Everything seems to be working out very well, so far.

Third Launch: A command capsule. Lying on the ground. Supremely boring.

Fourth Launch: Bob goes on a high suborbital trajectory before being recovered. Jeb makes it to Mun orbit. Not bad for the third real "launch"!

I'll be back with another episode the day after tomorrow (I think) so sit tight and hold on!

Have a very nice day, Individuals! Like, Favorite, Subscribe and Share please, and I'll see you next time with another episode of the KeeeEEEEEErbal Space Program!

PEACE!

Episode 3.

I'm reverting back to one of my old habits, VTOL building. It's rather a shame, but I made sure that my VTOL was able to do Science.

Getting a full ~75 Science from a couple of minutes of VTOL flying more than justifies the expense, though, especially with 97% funds back.

...

I guess that's it for now.

Have a very nice day, Individuals! Like, Favorite, Subscribe and Share please, and I'll see you next time with another episode of the KeeeEEEEEErbal Space Program!

PEACE!
